scenarioDescription:
The Qatar-8 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Qatar-8 is a star with 1.03 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.31 times its radius. It is located 918.12 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 8.3 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Qatar-8 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Qatar-8 system


Qatar-8 b

Qatar-8 b was discovered by the Qatar observatory, in 2019-06, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Qatar-8 b is 117.978 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Qatar-8 b is 14.404 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Qatar-8 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Qatar-8, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Qatar.
name: Qatar-8 - System With 1 Exoplanet
